title: Concept: Prefix Sums
content:
A Prefix Sum array allows you to calculate the sum of any subarray in O(1) time. 

Formula: P[i] = nums[0] + ... + nums[i]. 
Range Sum(i, j) = P[j] - P[i-1].

title: Concept: HashSet Power
content: A HashSet allows you to check if an item exists in O(1) time. Use this to avoid nested loops (O(N^2)) when searching for duplicates or specific values.

title: Concept: HashMap (Dictionary)
content: Use a HashMap when you need to store PAIRS of data (Key -> Value). In 'Two Sum', we map 'Value -> Index' so we can look up the complement instantly.

title: Concept: In-Place Modification
content: Sometimes you can use the input array itself as a storage container. By swapping elements to their correct index (e.g. putting 5 at index 4), you save O(N) space.

title: Concept: ASCII & Char Arrays
content:
For strings with only lowercase English letters, you don't need a HashMap. You can use an integer array of size 26. 
Index = ord(char) - ord('a').

title: Concept: Matrix Traversal
Concept: Two Pointers
content: Use two pointers when operating on a sorted array or needing to swap ends. Common patterns: Start/End converging, or Fast/Slow.
